text:
This is a pretty standard isapi transaction with mod_isapi update 416293. The isapi call sequence is Returns from ISAPI with HSE_STATUS_PENDING ServerSupportFunction with HSE_REQ_SEND_RESPONSE_HEADER_EX WriteClient ServerSupportFunction with HSE_REQ_DONE_WITH_SESSION It always returns a spurious error page after the correct response as seen from the ethereal trace below. ****Request*** GET /CSIS/CSISISAPI.dll/?request?811b2cfd-1c62-4055-869b- f7b39221c2ac;CCSISSvrCONN%3A%3AwaitForEvent%3B3%3B300%3B3%3B120 HTTP/1.1 User-Agent: CSISHttpReq Host: earls:5440 Cache-Control: no-cache ***Correct Response Header***** HTTP/1.1 200 OK Date: Fri, 06 Oct 2006 15:09:57 GMT Server: Apache/2.2.2 (Win32) Transfer-Encoding: chunked Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf-81c ***Correct Response Data**** 10;0xC110096D;6;EVWTTO;0;;0; 0 ***Spurious Response Data*** 1f1 200 OK

OK

The server encountered an internal error or misconfiguration and was unable to complete your request.

Please contact the server administrator, @@ServerAdmin@@ and inform them of the time the error occurred, and anything you might have done that may have caused the error.

More information about this error may be available in the server error log.

0
creator: artk@congruent.com
rpatkinson@bigpond.com
text:
I'm getting this same behaviour with isapi_416293 and httpd-2.2.3. I assume it 
is related to Bug #40470 where the response code 'seen' by apache is 1, even 
thought the http response header is 200. There are a few other reports of this 
in the net I found when googling.

An additional indication of this problem is that the actual number of bytes 
returned is greater than the number in the Content-Length header. For example, 
one of my pages has a content length of 27535 Bytes, but HttpWatch shows the 
size as 27805 Bytes.

I am having sever problems with compressed pages reloading repeatedly and I 
suspect that the error message is added to the returned data after 
compression, confusing MSIE6.1. MSIE7 and Mozilla apparently cope with this 
problem.

creator: wrowe@apache.org
text:
As guessed, this was a duplicate of an existing issue, now patched.

http://svn.apache.org/viewvc?view=rev&revision=492333

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 40470 ***
